website_summaries.verdict: A super-absorbent reusable swim diaper that's easy to put on and can be washed with the rest of your laundry.
pros: Comes in a variety of colors and patterns
Can reuse as many times as you need
cons: Tends to run small, so you may want to order a size up

customer_reviews.title: Beware of cheap knock-offs selling as "i play" items.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful. Make sure you receive the actual brand "i play"! I ordered the first pair, which was great, but it was getting snug on my 8-month old. So I decided to order two more for the next sizes up. I received crappy knock-offs. There was no padding at all and they didn't have the "i play" labels. Be careful when ordering from "gloous". I guess they just sell cheap knock-offs. Annoying!
customer_reviews.author: amylucha

customer_reviews.title: High quality! Excellent price! Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: These are well-made, high quality swim pants. They are very soft on the inside and the side snaps are useful for taking the pants off. These seem to run small, as the 3T is snug on our 2-year old (she wears size 24 months or size 2T in clothes). I highly recommend this product, but be aware of size differences. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not iPlay
customer_reviews.text: The product is falsely advertised as iPlay. It is not this brand. It is very thin for a swim diaper and I wouldn't trust it to hold anything in. It is well made, but is wayyyyy too large for the sizing chart provided. I am currently attempting a return and will update my review when that is done.
customer_reviews.author: Natassja R. Conway

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers but size up!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option for toddlers. They don’t poop as often as infants and their poop is more solid. I would not use this with an infant and their liquid poo. You would have to clean it constantly and it would be super gross. No thanks! I love not wasting a disposable diaper every time we swim, which is daily. In terms of size, order way up! My 20 month old is very tall, weighs around 35lbs and wears a 2t in clothes, and I bought him the 4T swim diaper. It’s a perfect fit. I wash this every night and air dry it. It has held up really nicely. Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: JenniferF

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: According to the size chart my son who is 13 months should be in a size 12m. I decided to up it one size since I wanted it to last all summer. Ordered the size 18m and it is somewhat tight on him, wish I would have ordered 24m. Other than that it’s great, love that fact that it’s reusable.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Cute and way better alternative to disposable swim diapers. I just toss in the washer after the pool and it's pretty easy to clean. I bought the 6 mi th size for my 5 month old who wears size 3-6 and I felt it was a little snug on his thighs (all babies are different). I also felt like it was hard to tuck all his boy parts in and wpuld have preferred it to open like a regular diaper that you lay flat and then strap around baby thighs rather than put 1 thigh in hole and then strap around other thigh. Will definitely re-order as baby grows.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT absorb like a traditional diaper
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT absorb urine! I put my toddler in this diaper with her swimsuit over the top and we drove to swim lessons. I know for a fact the clothes were dry when I buckled her in, but she and the car seat were sopping wet 10 minutes later, meaning she urinated and it went EVERYWHERE. So this is fine for containing a #2 in the pool, but do not expect it to keep a child dry outside of the pool before swimming
customer_reviews.author: LaneyG

customer_reviews.title: WAY TOO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: I bought TWO different sizes for my 10-month-old, I bought a 12month and an 18 month, the 12 months LOOKED too small so I didn't even bother trying it on him. the 18 months was so small I couldn't even button the two top buttons. He only weighs 21lbs, so he SHOULD have fit either one. But, any larger size and the leg holes would have been too big because the 18 months one had a fairly large gap around his thighs.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great swim diaper, but order up a size
customer_reviews.text: I bought this several months ago for use with my then 21 month old daughter. She was about 31 pounds, so based on the other reviews I ordered a 4T. Fits well, just the slightest bit loose but not so much that I worry about it not doing its job, though thankfully she never pooped in it while we were out. Great quality materials, with snap buttons that confidently lock the swimsuit into place. We can't go swimming anymore because of the lockdowns, but if you're lucky enough to have a private pool, then order up. I mean order up, but also order up one size from the chart, because it does seem to fit small.
customer_reviews.author: Mercury

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t buy it for swimming but love it
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use these for swimming. I have a two year old that’s has been pottery trained since she was 1 1/2. Every now and then she may pee at night. So I wanted something just one case a little came out. These work great for that purpose. However, if it’s a really heavy pee then of course like anything else it’s going to leak through. But if it’s just to catch a small amount or just enough that she realizes it and wakes up.. it does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but may run small, a must buy for water fun
customer_reviews.text: I love these iPlay swim diapers, and swore I would not use another brand. I like the feel, it's more cloth than plastic. And they work awesome, do an excellent job. Cleaning is a breeze, throw it in the wash and air dry. You never have to buy disposable swim diapers again. This product is a must buy if you frequent pools with your little one. I have just one issue, the sizes run small and when my 2 year old (was wearing the 4T) neared his 3rd birthday I had to buy a 5T but it was still too tight around the thighs and leaving red marks. Unfortunately I had to switch to another brand for a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller than the size chart recommends
customer_reviews.text: Our son is 21 months and in size 5 diapers (can fit in size 4 in a pinch), but the 3t size recommended on the chart left little red lines on his thighs and belly, so was a little too small. We liked it enough to buy the 4t in it though, if that says anything. Overall, it seems to be good quality, I like that it has snaps only one 1 side to make it quick to put on since there are 5 snaps. And I feel better about not using disposable ones for the maybe 20-30 minutes that he’s in a pool at a time.
customer_reviews.author: KWN

customer_reviews.title: Not true to size
customer_reviews.text: These are not true to size. We bought two sizes (one for each kid) and both were super small. The waist was ok, but the leg holes were terribly small to where it pinched them badly and left marks. My 3 year old complained that it hurt after only 10 minutes. We will be returning these and finding something else, not pleased with this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent
customer_reviews.text: These do only fit right the one direction so make sure you’re putting it on the right way. Absorbency is fantastic which has one minor drawback - if your kid was in the water and suddenly has to go potty, make sure you open the diaper to let out the pool water before you go inside. This thing really holds in the liquid and it doesn’t discriminate between urine and water! The first time it happened I thought the little one had an accident on the way to the potty but then still went a lot on the potty.
customer_reviews.author: Steph P.

customer_reviews.title: Bummed with the new version
customer_reviews.text: We have an iplay reusable diaper that was a hand me down - this original diaper is amazing and absorbs all liquid. When we needed the next size up I immediately ordered the iplay brand. However, this diaper does not seem to be made the same. My son peed his diaper as we were getting ready to go to the pool it soaked right through the diaper. The old diaper would absorb so well you almost had to smell it to notice if the child had an accident while wearing the item.
customer_reviews.author: AER

customer_reviews.title: Useless after one wash
customer_reviews.text: The 2T/3T size was small on my 22-month old, who is big but not huge. I washed it ONCE, following the instructions to wash it on delicate cycle and not dry, and the waist shrunk so badly that it is now unusable. Meanwhile, the leg holes seem to have stretched out. So if it did fit round his waist the poop would come out his leg holes anyways. Basically a VERY expensive disposable swim diaper. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit and quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: The smallest size only fit my 3 month old for a few weeks. Then the next size up (12 months) didnt fit at all. In addition one leg hole was significantly looser than the other. I think I may have gotten a defective one, but in any case this brand is not a good fit for my infant as both sizes were tight enough on his waist to make me feel it was uncomfortable for him. I would return them if I could, but its a diaper and babies are always peeing, who would want it. I simply have started using alva babys reusable cloth pocket diapers and they work much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mosspelt

customer_reviews.title: Ok, I like.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the quality and fit. But what impressed me the most was it also kept what was inside from leaking out. My wife put it on over my son's diaper when it arrived and forgot to take it off. Over time my boy eventually over loaded his diaper with his milk drinking but not one drop came out. The inside was totally saturated. This thing might double for an extra layer of protection against his leaking diapers while he sleeps.
customer_reviews.author: Tegeras

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Brand
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year old is potty trained, but is required to wear a swim diaper in the pool during her lessons. I was worried when purchasing a 3T for my newly 2T-sized child, but the i play. sizes jump from 24m to 3T, so I took a chance. It fits perfectly and is stretchy enough that she has room to grow. She's comfortable and the bathing suit washes well. We're always happy with i play.'s products!
customer_reviews.author: mandalin

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, buy size up and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: These for sure run small! My son isn't even two yet, and no, he is not a big kid at all, and I had to go up to size 3 instead of 2. He is 29 pounds and the Size 2 was way too tight and he complained as soon as I put them on and could not walk right at all. The size 3 fit much better. He has already went number two in them at the pool once, and these completely kept the poop in. They work great, we go to the pool almost daily and always have these on!
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: BYE BYE EXPENSIVE, SOGGY SWIM DIAPERS
customer_reviews.text: We didn't see the point of "swim diapers" that just soaked up tons of water, seemed uncomfortable, and were expensive! So, I ordered these "swim panties" for our granddaughter who is almost 2, just as an experiment. LOVE THEM!!! They fit snugly but out baby is narrow through her hips so I can't speak for general sizing. But, the product is great! They are easy on/off, fit well under her swimsuit, seem to be comfortable, and are easy to rinse and hang to dry! This was an experiment that went well! GREAT value and a sensible answer to a puzzling summer question.
customer_reviews.author: Grace's D

customer_reviews.title: Such a good buy! Lasted 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: These worked so well for us for the past 6 months. My daughter is petite and is just about to grow out of them. Unfortunately, they wore out before she grew out - they no longer hold in the urine (I learned this the hard way after holding her in my white shirt!). It may be because I laundered them wrong, I never reviewed their washing directions. Anyway, most kids would grow out of them long before they lose their waterproofing, so still gets 5 stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: Laura G

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my toddler who swims every day to save vs buying the disposable swim diapers. She is comfortable in it while swimming or running around the yard in between swims. Easy to put on her/take off either laying down or standing up due to the side snaps. She hasn’t pooped in it yet (and hopefully won’t) so I can’t say how it holds that in. And who can tell if they pee in it since it is soaked from the pool water?! Overall I’m very pleased with my purchase. And I have a very happy toddler!
customer_reviews.author: Latin Mass Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great reusable swim option
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I hated using disposable swim diapers because of the environmental factor. I didn't realize, though, that this wouldn't absorb when my 14 month old went to the bathroom. She peed before we made it out the door to get to the pool and there was a wet spot (not quite a puddle) on the floor where she was sitting. I'm not sure any swim diaper will absorb as well as a real one, though. This one is a breeze to put on and take off because of the side snaps. I'll def buy more when she goes up a size.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for swimming
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month old is 22 pounds, and it fits her perfectly. We were able to get over 2 hours of pool time without any leakage. It’s EASY to clean and easy to put on and off. It also isn’t too puffy so it fits under her bathing suit good.
customer_reviews.author: Mandii Mew

customer_reviews.title: Buying the next size
customer_reviews.text: Why waste when you can reuse? This swimmer diaper worked pretty flawlessly. I say pretty because some loose stools can escape. I did buy a larger size to maximize use. Could have also been the reason for some escape. I will be buying the next size for baby for next summer. The swimmer is great quality, thick and cleaned easily. I found that if there was an accident the hose cleans the whole diaper perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Erinsryno

customer_reviews.title: This product is 1 size off and runs small
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 22 mth old grandson who is 22 pds small frame, he usually is in a size 12-18 th clothes and wear a 24 mth i play swim diaper. It has a snug fit around the legs and waist. It runs small so it's best to gho 1 size larger to fit, or 2 sizes if your child grows fast and you want it to last a summer. A 24 mth size should fit up to 25 lbs, 25-30lbs I would definitely go with a 3T.
customer_reviews.author: patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a gift for a little girl, so I haven’t opened to check the quality or fit...but so far the packaging was perfect and the product looks very high quality. I’m happy and definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie Manzano

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 2 month old and the 6months barely fit my chunk ... size up if you have a chunky baby
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Go Up 3-4 Sizes
customer_reviews.text: I got the 24month size for my 14month old daughter and they just fit. That was May, now the 24month is waaaaay too small. We got one wear out of them... she probably needs a 4T now in this brand. Very disappointed how tiny these are. Based on the recommendation of reviewers I had gone up but not by enough. Cute, well made, but double your kids age to get the right size.
customer_reviews.author: A. Morton

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it.
customer_reviews.text: At the same time, I purchased the other style (no buttons) from my local target store. I didn't even know they sold there. Those ones worked perfectly fine, did the job. These ones however, the buttons press into babys thighs and have left a bruise. Would not recommend these ones. I would suggest to the seller to maybe use something softer? A covered fabric snap perhaps?
customer_reviews.author: Queenofthree

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small
customer_reviews.text: By the nature of this product, you want a snug fit ... but I suggest sizing up by at least one to two full sizes. My child usually wears 24 month or 2T clothes, so we bought the 3T - but it still leaves imprints on his legs and waist when taking it off after wearing for less than an hour. Over all, a decent product and I’m going to order another in a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper, but run very small
customer_reviews.text: These are great reusable swim diapers, made well, work perfect for the pool, but they run very small. I found the sizing listed with these to be incredibly wrong, they were replaced/exchanged very quickly which was nice. My little one weighs 16lbs which should have been around the 6month size. I originally orders the 12mo size to give her longer use, but the 12 mo was so tight on her that it was leaving red marks and I could barely snap the snaps so I eye changed for the 18 month size and it fits her much better with no pinching.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality but way to small
customer_reviews.text: My son just turned 2, and usually wears a 2-3 years of age in H&m and Zara and target clothes. I got this in 3-4 years old and it barely fit on him,he's about 34 pounds, tall kid not chubby. So this is why I gave it a 4, because of the size fit but otherwise very good nice quality product and does its job. My son had an accident in it once in the pool and it was easily taken care of and washed and put right back on him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go a size up at least!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7m old and in 6-9m clothing, getting close to 12m clothing. I bought the 12m size, and it fits him but I don’t feel it will for long, definitely will have a pooplosion if he does one in it, doesn’t go really high up in the back with the size I got. But love the material and that it snaps off on one side. Can wear under swim shorts or by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I still got peed on
customer_reviews.text: Its nice that they're reusable and machine washable. They seem to fit a bit small but not a big deal. The deal breaker for me? I just got peed on in a public place because I trusted the description that these were waterproof. They do hold the "solids" quite well, though. We spent the whole day at a water park and they held up fine. My kid seemed comfortable and no noticeable chafing around the legs or waist.
customer_reviews.author: L. Spare

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I actually really like this one so far. I used it for my 1 year old in the pool a couple days ago. I put it under her bathing suit. It was wayyyyy easier to put on because of the side buckles. She didnt have deep red marks from the elastic either (but that might be because its a tiny bit big for now) It held up in the wash on gentle cycle, I did not dry it in the washer.
customer_reviews.author: Si

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite swim diaper!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our favorite swim diaper. 5 snaps may be a bit of excess in what is needed but the fit is great. You definitely get what you pay for. I will be purchasing more of this particular brand of swim diaper. It fits both my 4T thinner and taller kid and my 2T stocky kid. It doesn’t leave red lines on either of them and stays put quite nicely.
customer_reviews.author: pups1911

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! But why the snaps?
customer_reviews.text: I have a 22 pound 20-month-old and bought the i play reusable swim diaper and rash guard long sleeve both in the 24 months size. The diaper seems a little small while the shirt is too big. The description says that the snaps allow for easy changes, but honestly I think they are pretty pointless. I would recommend the manufacturer either ditch the snaps altogether or put the snaps on both sides of the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mom

customer_reviews.title: One leg opening was too loose
customer_reviews.text: I was required to purchase a waterproof swim diaper for my son to use at aquatherapy. One leg fit fine. The other leg, on the snap closure side, was gaping open! No way to adjust it, so no way was it keeping poop in. I put my regular reusable swim diaper over it, which fits snugly at the legs and waist to contain solids. Because of the poor fit, water got into the absorbent layer, causing the leg to gape further. When I opened things back up after therapy, poop was everywhere, but contained within the second diaper on top.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: I love how you only have to button up one side! Makes putting on and taking off super easy especially with a baby who just loves to be on the move lol the white is also so simple and goes with any swimsuit! Very comfy and absorbent. Baby hasn’t had to go in it yet but I would imagine it will do it’s job and keep everything in! Lol
customer_reviews.author: SKKE

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but be careful about sizing
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to be of high quality. Other reviews mentioned that the product is small so I got the 4T size for my 2 3/4 year old, who is in the neighborhood of 32-35 pounds. It still seems quite tight around the waist, but maybe this is intentional to keep diaper contents in there. It is possible to undo the top snap to make it a little looser.
customer_reviews.author: Raccoon Face

customer_reviews.title: Great baby product!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE These swim diapers! They are reusable, and so soft compared to the plasticy disposable options. The diapers are easy on and off. They run small so order a size or two larger. I ordered 3T for my 18 month old, but he had rather chunky thighs. The legs are supposed to be snug so no poo escapes. They hold up to multiple washes, I just hang them to dry. I ordered both blue and white and they are as pictured. The colors and patterns do show through light colored swim suits so keep that in mind if it's something that bothers you.
customer_reviews.author: Expat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to get on and off even when wet.
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It is easy to get one and off with the snaps. However, sometimes its hard to know which was is front or back and even top or bottom. A better way to distinguish this would help. It holds pee unlike the disposable diapers and cleans well when pooped in (make sure not to let it sit for too long and rinse ASAP before wash). Love that it is another way to reduce our carbon footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit - Order by size chart not age
customer_reviews.text: I definitely suggest using the size/weight chart before choosing a size. I ordered the 6 month size for my 4 1/2 month old that weighs 15 lbs and it fits well - no gaps or looseness near the legs or waist. He has not pooped while wearing it yet, but based on fit I am confident it would stay contained. I almost wish it had snaps on both sides rather than just the one. I feel like might end up being a bit of a mess to change if it was poopy.
customer_reviews.author: Leann

customer_reviews.title: Great reusable swim diaper.
customer_reviews.text: We have to use these for our son’s swim lessons. Love this brand. Fits well and is environmentally friendly. They also have so many cute fabrics to choose from. Swim trunks for over these but it’s just as easy to use these by themself so you don’t have to pull off several layers of wet clothes. They’re even a bit absorbent, vs disposable swim diapers to get you from home to the pool in the event your kid pees before you get there!
customer_reviews.author: Moof

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very average sized for her age, even slightly on the petite side and the 6 month size at 6 months for her was just a little too snug and the 12 month size at 9 months was way too snug. Great swim diaper but size up, it was cutting into her legs which aren’t chubby at all!
customer_reviews.author: Christal T

customer_reviews.title: a little small
customer_reviews.text: Smaller/tighter than I expected, so it looked uncomfortable and difficult to put on. I wasn't sure it was gonna reach to snap. And then it was kinda bunched to once side and wouldn't straighten out. I guess it needs to be tight to keep everything in, and my son didn't seem uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: AMarsh2177

customer_reviews.title: Snaps are necessary!!
customer_reviews.text: Cute and actually fits well! My son is 7 months and 24 lbs so the others were quite small and his booty cheeks hung out but not these haha. I also love the snap side. When they do poop, it’s MUCH easier/cleaner to get off than ones that do not unsnap. Also super hard to get off wet, snaps are necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Gray

customer_reviews.title: Not True To Size (Too Small)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 12 mo size and used when baby was 7 months 15 lb. He wore 9-12 month clothing. At first glance, it looked good and fit fine. After about 20 minutes wearing, he had red marks of where the lining around legs were. Too tight. Passed window of return, but definitely can’t count on sizing.
customer_reviews.author: shopper

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to accidents!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 24mths for 18mth old. Fit perfectly! Like the convenience of disposable swim diapers but they don’t hold pee so got this as a second backup. Baby wore disposable and this on top. Incase of blowout. Diaper held up when baby peed on the way to the beach, phew! Also looks great without swim shorts, comfy and baby able to move a around! Prefer over honest brand or similar style. Buttons are a plus!
customer_reviews.author: LeelooTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: A summer staple
customer_reviews.text: We use this under all of my little one's regular bathing suits and it gets the job done so we don't have to use disposable swim diapers. Word to the wise: They are meant to stop solids, not necessarily liquids. Change into a regular diaper when going inside to hang out, and keep off white patio furniture. :)
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice & works good (not perfect)
customer_reviews.text: I use this diaper so our 2 1/2 to grandson can join me in our "hot tub". Of course I turn the temperature way down so it's more like a pool. It didn't contain a mess quite as well as I'd hoped; some did leak out, so I've started using a swim diaper under it. I feel very sure with two layers I won't have to clean out & sanitize "big pool" again!
customer_reviews.author: Ladygray4

customer_reviews.title: Not for curvy babies with the cute thighs
customer_reviews.text: I tried so so sooooo hard to like this. The quality seemed great and I’m sure the absorbency was awesome. But we never got into the water with it. My 9 month old struggled so much to fit into any of them. Even up to 4T! It fit her waist fine but her poor thighs....hmm get it from her momma? Lol I tried so hard. Went through so many sizes. Sadly all returned.
customer_reviews.author: Fatty

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept, and prefer re-usable items to disposable (especially chemically produced diapers). But both times I used it for my almost 2 year old, it leaked #2. Ineffective diaper so far, but hopefully it fits tighter and works better as my son grows. On a positive note, it's very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi N

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of your disposable swim diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought one of these sooner! Easy to put on, more absorbent than a swim diaper (i.e. you can't tell when your kid pees, my son would pee in a swim diaper and the urine would run down his legs!) After a swim we just hang this to dry with the rest of the swim cloths. We have only used it a couple of times but it has worked so well! My son normally wears a 5T so this may be a bit big on a kid who wears a 4T. It fits my boy perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Price

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent purchase. Ordered size 12 Months for my petite 18 month old in accordance with the size chart and it fits well, snug but not too tight to be uncomfortable. She has worn it 4 or 5 times now in our little backyard pool and it has worked perfectly. It keeps Number Two well contained without anything seeping into the water, and it is easy to wash with hot soap and water. I plan on ordering a second diaper to use as a backup for our upcoming beach trip.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: I would size up. My baby is average size and this fit way small, we couldn’t button it up all the way and it was a little uncomfortable for him.
customer_reviews.author: Brynn C.

customer_reviews.title: Where did I put it?
customer_reviews.text: So this reusable swim diaper was wonderful the one time my nephew used it. It was absorbent and comfortable. When he went home I put it "somewhere safe" so he could use it the next time he came over. I have no clue where that "somewhere safe" place is. So yeah, great diaper for one use. After the first use, I couldn't tell you!
customer_reviews.author: Diane C.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful when washing this swimmy. It ruined an entire load of clothes by the dying the whole load. My baby is 4 months 18 pounds and I got a “12 month” size. I should have sized up it’s very snug and he won’t be able to wear it for too long. The snaps are also extremely hard to snap together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs way to small.
customer_reviews.text: It works great only problem is they run way to small. My son is 4T so originally bought a 4T it was to small, so I bought a 5T. It was too small around his belly and my kid is skinny for his age. So now I just leave the top 2 snaps undone and it fits fine that way.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Clean
customer_reviews.text: Fits nice and snug, not too loose or too tight. Really, you don't necessarily have to unsnap the buttons in order to get it on but, once it's wet, it becomes almost impossible to take it off unless you unsnap the buttons. My did pee in it but you would never have known as it stay within the fabric while in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Size up 2x and then it’s perfect
customer_reviews.text: Size up and size up again. My son is comfortably in 2t pants/shorts and based on other reviews I bought a 4t which fit perfect. Otherwise it performs great and he seemed very comfy all day. Also washed well after being worn at the beach with some sand discoloration.
customer_reviews.author: MegB

customer_reviews.title: Size up
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality. Would recommend sizing up. Baby is 8 months old and we got the 24 month size. They fit great now and will have some room to grow. Once they are soaked with water they won't hold pee, just leaks out once it hits its max liquid hold.
customer_reviews.author: G.Macniak

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Very cute. Possibly but a size up.
customer_reviews.text: My only negative is that I should’ve bought a larger size. My baby is 6 months. He’s probably more of a size 7 month. I’d say we don’t have much longer to get out of these. However, they are really well made. Very cute. Snaps/poppers are really secure. Great quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Debs Malia

customer_reviews.title: Cute but wish there was more stretch
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Absorbent & holds up everytime my daughter swims. The snaps make it super easy to take on and off. The only down side is they shrink very easily so I would order a size up. They are very tight on her after only using and washing a couple times.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: NO BUTTONS
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this swim diaper because I liked the button feature on the side. The swim diapers I received had NO BUTTONS. Just a pull on swim diaper. We have pull on swim diapers that are the same brand and I wanted to try the style with buttons. We will keep them because they work for us fine but this product was not as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M

customer_reviews.title: This is the only swim diaper we need!
customer_reviews.text: We only use this for swimming. It's much easier and cheaper than using disposable swim diapers! My son (almost 2) has never pooped in it, but I would think it would be hold it. It's easy to wash and it's also easy to just dry outside.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mentel

customer_reviews.title: Elastic does not stand up to use
customer_reviews.text: I liked the diaper when I first used u It on my daughter. It did what it was suppose to and it was easy to clean. The leg area was fitted and created a great seal....until now. After having it for a month and maybe a dozen uses, the elastic around the leg area is no longer fitting correctly. One side is no longer fitted, thereby defeating the whole point of being a leak proof swimmer. Disappointed b/c IPlay had such great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Chiang

customer_reviews.title: Great swim diaper
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great swim diaper for my baby and it is nice not to have to buy a package of swim diapers, only to have a bunch leftover. My only problem is that he quickly grew out of this and I wish I'd bought a larger one, but that is life.
customer_reviews.author: C. London

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Love this this is an option for our little one. Purchased 2 and couldn't be happier we don't have to use the expensive (uncomfortable) disposables. Use for our 2 year old, ordered a 3T, does have growing room but didn't want to order too small. Perfect fit, doesn't fall off and appears to be comfortable with zero irritation.
customer_reviews.author: Matt younger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect swim diaper
customer_reviews.text: We now have this same diaper in 3 colors. It is super easy to put on, easy snaps, cute colors and easy to clean. It doesn't hold the liquid as with all swim diapers, but holds #2 in great! Then easy to spray out with a hose if a #2 accident happens. After main mess is gone, throw in the washer and all good. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke R.

customer_reviews.title: Runs small. Order a size up
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 7 months old, but long and lean. 26” 16lbs. We got the 6 month and it was just barely too small. I love the diaper though. So I will probably buy again in a bigger size. I do wish it snapped on both sides since it’s hard to peel a wet swimsuit off a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Meowtha

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Overall I do like the brand, especially their hats for toddlers, but I found the diaper too heavy, uncomfortable, and not very flattering even to a cute toddler. It looks like a huge full diaper and I found on Amazon another swim diaper which was lighter than this one
customer_reviews.author: Limlim128

customer_reviews.title: A nice alternative to disposable swim diapers
customer_reviews.text: This diaper works well for pool use. The snaps make this reusable diaper all that much easier to remove when water logged. My granddaughter is 22 months and I bought a 24 month diaper. It is a bit snug around the thighs, but a good fit overall. As others have said, this diaper isn't absorbent enough outside the pool. I think it is best for a toddler close to being potty trained. This washes up well and is very soft.
customer_reviews.author: nana D

customer_reviews.title: Much better for the enviroment and easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had used these with my first child instead of buying packages of disposable swim diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Great swim diaper
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wears a 3T and we ordered the 4T so that it would fit longer. It fits her well with room to grow! It definitely holds in #2 and holds in a little bit of pee. It doesn’t go dribbling down her legs. I’ve put it through the washer and dryer twice, and it’s held it’s form well. I’m so glad I bought this instead of continuing to use disposable swim diapers!
customer_reviews.author: John Michel

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit
customer_reviews.text: This diaper only has snaps on one side, so it’s hard to put on and take off. It’s hard to get it on straight. The elastic is tight but he fabric is baggy. My poor toddler would end up with the elastic in his butt. We got the GroVia swim diaper and it’s much, much better.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these with my oldest child. This one just does not fit the same- very bulky, very tight elastic on the waist/legs. It’s absorbent but that’s about it. Not my favorite! We ended up buying 2 From primary and love them way more!
customer_reviews.author: JSG

customer_reviews.title: Run very small
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but they run very small. I ordered a 12month size, as recommend in other comments, for my 7 month old buy was still too small.
customer_reviews.author: jennylynn

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!! Buying the next few sizes up!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! I will say that it runs slightly small (at least for my girl) and I am bummed to have only gotten a summer's worth of use out of it. But I plan to purchase several more in the next sizes up because this worked so well. Why didn't I think of using reusable swim diapers sooner?!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect most affordable swim diaper.
customer_reviews.text: This swim diaper has been great, it doesn't leak which is the most important part! Its very easy to clean, and has buttons to button it up. I would buy a couple pairs, I only had 1 pair for a while and eventually a button came off but it still fits wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Conde Family

customer_reviews.title: Get this kind with snaps!
customer_reviews.text: We've had our share of swim diapers having a child with GI issues. I just wish that they made them in bigger sizes as I'm going to soon be looking for the next size up and iPlay doesn't make them larger (as far as I can find). Face it, some kids still have accidents past 3-4 years. It'd be nice to find a company that is inclusive of kids of all abilities for both swim diapers and training pants!!! But these are a great brand, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I liked it so much I bought a second pair. Wouldn’t suggest putting them in the drier they might shrink... or my baby grew fast. My baby pooped in them and I was able to hose it off and it came out easily. Held it all in the diaper none got in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bellamy

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I've had great experiences with other iplay reusable swim diapers, but these suck. My daughter had a bowel movement in one and it went EVERYWHERE. They don't even hold in pee. Very disappointed. At least they're easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds in all accidents big and small!
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. My son had an accident in the pool and this swim suit held it all in without a mess! Thank Goodness!! It would of been a big mess but it did a really good job and fits well!!
customer_reviews.author: Sad inside

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Diaper seems great but I can’t give 5 starts bc I ordered size 12 month for my 9 month old thats in the 45th percentile, and it’s so tight I’m worried about it cutting off her circulation. I would return if it was worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan and Jessica Moore

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 30 days
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this swim diaper for 30 days and just took it out of the wash to see that one of the snaps came off. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BuckeyeGirl81

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!  Well made with good fabric.
customer_reviews.text: Stellar product. It's very well made and no concern for leaks. Buy two if swimming is a daily thing. It's so absorbent, if you hang it to dry it's wet the next day. Dries in the dryer fine. It might dry quicker outside. I had hung it up in the bathroom. I really like it. There matching sun hats are great too.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Love the snaps down the side. Only way to make it better would be two have snaps on both sides (in case of a code brown). I’ve been using these for about two weeks now, every day at the pool. And I’ve not had any leaks or issues.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Reed

customer_reviews.title: Adorable, but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my to wear in his little pool for hot summer days. I love them. The only thing is that they run a little small; I got the 24mo for my 13mo old son, 24lbs, and they fit just right at the moment. Although, my hopes were to have him wear this all through summer. Other than that, they are very worth the price--just size up.
customer_reviews.author: Saeteurn

customer_reviews.title: Size up if your baby has chunky thighs. Worth purchasing and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for toddler who has chunky legs. She is 3t, which I purchased. It fit well the first couple times. After a few washes it got snug around the thighs so I purchased a size bigger and we hang to dry.
customer_reviews.author: C Sliwa

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AWESOME. we have a pool so we are swimming almost everyday and disposable diapers were getting expensive. I originally bought a 4T for my 2 1/2 year old as he has thicker thighs and currently wears 3T, but it was huge. I returned for the 3T and it fits perfectly! my son is 34 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: SChesin

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat them
customer_reviews.text: Got these on sale. My daughter takes swim lessons and they prefer these to the disposable swim diapers. Make sure to only put them in before going in water. We learned the hard way when we had her wear the diaper in the car; they will leak. The negative is obviously if they have a bowel movement in them, not fun to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Good swim diaper
customer_reviews.text: It's easier to put on/remove than I imagined it would be, with only one side with snaps. I think it would be better if the other side opened as well though. Otherwise, it's soft and slightly absorbent so I don't worry about little accidents. My daughter seems comfortable in it when she's playing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dion

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this money saver.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product twice and have been pleased with them. Saves lots of money on those swim diapers that land up in landfills. I would like to see bigger sizes for special needs kids.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Simon

customer_reviews.title: Why didn't I order one sooner?
customer_reviews.text: This reusable swim diaper is perfect. It's easy to get on and off and super snug. I'm using it for my toddler who is normally in a size 2T or 3T. I ordered the 3T and it fits great for swim class now, but I can tell it's going to give her a little room to grow too. I can't believe I wasted all the money on the disposable ones when this is such a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: If your kid poops in the pool a lot, get a suit with snaps on both sides
customer_reviews.text: As the title suggests: if you kid is a big pool pooper, you will be better off having snaps on both sides. My kiddo pooped once in this suit and it was PREEEETTY disgusting having to slide one of her legs out. Otherwise, I can't really complain, it does its job :)
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Fowler-Finn

customer_reviews.title: Great swim diaper, but a bit small
customer_reviews.text: This is the best swim diaper I have tried so far! I love the snaps on the side and it seems comfortable for my daughter. I used it twice and realized she needed one a bit bigger so her butt was covered better so I bought the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Please just buy disposable
customer_reviews.text: Unless your baby/toddler is in the water every day, save yourself a mess and buy disposable. Both my boys (aged 2 and 1) pooped in these the first use and with the water and all, it was a DISASTER! And we didn't have back-up diapers, so my husband had to run to the store to buy some. We threw both of these out immediately. Not worth it for us. We go to the pool maybe 1-2 times per week in the summer, so we are sold on disposable, probably forever.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: i Play. by Green Sprouts Baby Snap Reusable Swim Diaper
product_meta.description:
Trim, lightweight, and comfortable swim diaper encourages swimming—Baby will move freely during swim lessons without feeling weighed down. No bulky fabric and extra snaps, our baby swim diaper is cute enough to wear alone, but slim enough to wear under a standard baby swimsuit. 

Patented design is breathable, absorbent, and waterproof—As the original swim diaper manufacturer, our patented triple-layer design offers superior function and comfort. The wicking liner is breathable against baby’s skin and helps prevent diaper rash. The inner absorbent layer helps protect against messes outside the pool without puffing up, while the waterproof outer layer works with the snug-fitting waist and legs to offer secure protection from accidents. A snug fit and frequent diaper checks are essential for any swim diaper to prevent pool accidents, see the size chart for more information. U.S. Pat. No. 7,678,094

No other diaper necessary! Economical and creates less waste—Save money and reduce waste with our machine-washable, reusable swim diaper compared to disposable swim diapers. 

Easy-lock side snaps—Convenient for easy on-and-off and diaper changes.

UPF 50+ sun protection—All i play. by green sprouts Swim and Sun Wear offer excellent sun protection by blocking 97.5%-99+% of UV rays.

Meets STANDARD 100 BY OEKO-TEX certification for your baby’s health and safety—Products with the STANDARD 100 by OEKO-TEX label have been independently tested for over 350 harmful substances that go beyond global legal regulations. Label: SH020 131584 TESTEX.

Trusted by national swim schools and private swim instructors—Many national and international swim schools, private swim instructors, and municipalities only trust our reusable swim diapers in their pools during swim lessons. 

Made in BSCI-compliant factories for f
feature_bullets: Care Instructions : If your baby has soiled the diaper, dispose of any solids into the toilet and wash in cold water. Machine wash cold. Only non-chlorine bleach when needed. Tumble dry low or hang to dry. Do not iron. Do not dry clean
Snug fit helps contain solid matter & is approved for public pool
